title: gg-hint.exe and ck-hint.exe
content:
gg-hint.exe and ck-hint.exe are computerized hint sheets that were shipped with the game on disk, made when Apogee stopped shipping actual printed sheets in 1994.

Does anyone still have them and can they be uploaded for download?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

title: hmm...
content: When I purchased my Invasion of the Vorticons trilogy, back in 1992, it was shipped to me with a burgundy piece of paper that had the hint sheet already printed on it. I lost it less than a month after I got it, but I remember it telling the names of the enemies, the cheat codes, and a few general hints about the game... I wish I still had it.

title: Re: hmm...
content:

title: Who has ckhint.exe
content:
I know Litude has ckhint.exe

[quote]Quote:[hr]I just checked the CKHINT.EXE file and there's no mention of the "fish" in it, so I bet we'll just have to stick with Stranded Fish.[hr][/quote]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pogo.gif[/img]

title: Re: Who has ckhint.exe
content:
Yeah, I happen to have both of 'em, but I'm not sure whether its legal to upload them, but seeing as you contributed the CGA Keen 6 patch I'll have to take that risk. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[url=http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/ckhints.zip]real_hotdog.sitesled.com/...khints.zip[/url]

title: Re: Who has ckhint.exe
content:
I have txt files with the content of both of those two exe's. Almost certain these are from the combo CD from 3drealms, can verify this when I get home.
Anyone need just the text?

title: wonder
content: I always wondered where the names 'Butler' and 'Tank' robot came from, and I always thought the tin can guy had a little hat!
